page.title: 10BOXTED PARISH CHURCH
page.content: St.Peter's church Boxted was built in the 12th century and was just a simple nave.A north and South aisle were added in 14th century and the roof was raised.Two dormer type windows were added to the south wall which give a cottage style look to the outside of the church. The present rector is Douglas Lancashire M.A.,B.D., who lives at Langham and serves both Langham and Boxted Churches.There are usually two services each Sunday but times vary to fit in with the Langham Church.Four Holy Communion Services,two Evensong ,one Morning Prayer and one Family Service are held each month. There is a good relationship with the Methodist Church and a joint service is held in the Village Hall on the fourth Sunday of each month.The church roof and the heating need repairing.
